subject: Sleep
title: What Is a Sleep Study
description: A 60-second lesson on What Is a Sleep Study.

hook.text: You arrive at a lab, get wired up with dozens of sensors, and then they tell you to sleep normally. Good luck.

buildup.text: A polysomnography records brain waves, eye movements, heart rate, breathing, and leg movements.

discovery.text: Technicians monitor your data all night, scoring every 30-second block into a specific sleep stage.

twist.text: The first night is often unusable. People sleep so poorly in a lab that they need a second night.

climax.text: Despite its awkwardness, polysomnography remains the gold standard for diagnosing sleep disorders.

punchline.text: The best sleep test requires the worst sleep ever.

quiz.question: Why is the first night of a sleep study often discarded?
options: Patients sleep poorly in unfamiliar settings
